message: I am looking for a good book or tutorial on how to deploy a Rails 3 app on EC2 any recommendations?
There shouldn't be anything ec2-specific for your deployment -- just use capistrano to deploy to passenger+(apache2 | nginx).
@mrm have you tried ec2 on rails?
Dotcloud and heroku are both great options that abstract out some of the direct management headaches.
The deployment gets a bit harder when using the elastic load balancer and N servers. Any good practices for that?

@rbreve ec2 allows you to create an instance with selected OS snapshot and a a result you have remote server with SHH access. This hosting is not like Heroku. We configure and deploy out projects ourselves. Also it's possible to save already configured system as image to apply it to other your instances.
Chef is a highly-rated configuration management tool.  They do have some EC2/Rails deployment tuts.  The docs weren't very up to date when I did it.  YMMV.
@rbreve Yes -- it's how AdGrok runs, along with delayed_job and an ELB in front
We run on ubuntu images with system-installed RVM to manage the ruby and gem installs
